commander.name: William Henry Ewart Gott
commander.notes: Nickname 'Strafer Gott'. Replaced O'Moore Creagh after Operation Battleaxe failure. Promoted from brigadier to major-general.

Matilda II Infantry Tank.notes: Reduced from Q2 after Operation Battleaxe losses (48 Matildas lost)

Stuart M3 (Honey).notes: First American tanks arriving in small numbers Q3 1941

tanks.notes: Tank strength reduced from 190 (Q2) to 172 after Operation Battleaxe losses (91 tanks lost June 1941). Replacements arriving through Q3 include more Crusaders and first American Stuart tanks. Operational readiness ~91% during rebuilding phase.

halftracks.notes: British Army did not use halftracks in 1941. Universal Carriers used instead.

Ordnance QF 25-pounder Gun-Howitzer.notes: 2 RHA regiments (3rd RHA, 4th RHA) with 32 guns each

Ordnance QF 2-pounder.notes: Inadequate vs. German armor - known weakness exposed at Battleaxe

fighters.notes: No organic air assets. RAF support from separate commands.

supply_logistics.supply_status: Rebuilding after Operation Battleaxe losses (June 1941). Tank replacements arriving through Q3. Fuel and ammunition adequate for defensive operations but constrained for major offensives. Water supply prioritized due to summer heat. British logistics more robust than Axis due to shorter supply lines from Egypt.
supply_logistics.notes: Shorter supply lines from Egyptian depots (Alexandria, Cairo) compared to Axis forces. Forward supply dumps at Maaten Bagush and Sidi Barrani. Water consumption higher in Q3 summer heat.

weather_environment.terrain_type: coastal plain and rocky desert (Western Desert, Egypt)
weather_environment.notes: Peak desert summer. Minimal rainfall. Occasional sandstorms. Extended daylight enables long operational days. Heat stress significant on personnel and vehicles. Dust impacts engine maintenance.

subordinate_units.status: Rebuilding after Battleaxe - equipped with remaining Matildas
subordinate_units.notes: Lost 48 Matildas at Battleaxe, rebuilt with 52 tanks by September

subordinate_units.status: Operational - equipped with Crusaders and cruiser tanks
subordinate_units.notes: Receiving new Crusader Mk II tanks during Q3

subordinate_units.status: Operational - motorized infantry and artillery support
subordinate_units.notes: Includes motorized infantry battalions and field artillery
Premier British desert reconnaissance unit with extensive combat experience

tactical_doctrine.role: Premier British armoured division ('Desert Rats') with extensive desert warfare experience. Specialized in mobile armoured operations, reconnaissance in depth, and combined arms coordination.
special_capabilities: Combined arms coordination (armor, artillery, motorized infantry)
tactical_innovations: 'Jock Column' battlegroups - mixed tanks, artillery, infantry
Leaguer defensive positions for night security
known_issues: Inadequate anti-tank guns (2-pounder vs. German armor)
Matilda II too slow for mobile operations
Operation Battleaxe lessons: vulnerability to 88mm guns
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Fully adapted to desert operations with specialized maintenance, water discipline, navigation, and terrain understanding. Continuous operations since 1940 provide unmatched British desert expertise.

historical_context.formation: Formed as Mobile Division (Egypt) 1938, redesignated 7th Armoured Division 1939-10-01

q3_1941_status.post_battleaxe: Recovering and rebuilding after Operation Battleaxe failure (June 15-17, 1941)
q3_1941_status.losses: 91 tanks lost at Battleaxe (48% of engaged strength)
q3_1941_status.command_change: O'Moore Creagh replaced by William Gott (August 4, 1941)
q3_1941_status.rebuilding: Receiving tank replacements, new Crusader Mk II variants, first Stuart tanks
q3_1941_status.training: Incorporating Battleaxe lessons: better combined arms, AT gun inadequacy
q3_1941_status.preparation: Building up strength for Operation Crusader offensive (November 1941)

historical_context.previous_operations: Operation Compass (Dec 1940-Feb 1941): Destroyed Italian 10th Army. Operation Brevity (May 1941). Operation Battleaxe (June 1941).

special_rules: Desert Rats: +1 morale in desert terrain
Mixed Tank Quality: Matildas slow/armored, Crusaders fast/unreliable
Inadequate AT: -1 vs. German medium/heavy armor (2-pdr weakness)
Post-Battleaxe: -1 morale for first scenario (recovering from defeat)
